main: ^Question: Regular exercise can boost your mood by releasing endorphins. This valuable health tip is backed by numerous studies conducted by the World Health Organization (WHO).
answer: ^Regular exercise is associated with the release of endorphins, which are neurotransmitters that act as natural painkillers and mood elevators.
^The World Health Organization (WHO) recognizes the positive impact of regular physical activity on mental well-being.
^Numerous studies support the idea that exercise can contribute to improved mood and overall mental health.
